conclusion_3: The prisonner has been sacrificed. You've generated a lot of magic.
event_text:
The prisonners are restless. They might require some shock therapy.
Option 1: Give them a good whack.
Option 2: Kill them
Option 3: Sacrifice them.

conclusion_1: Unbelievable! You've saved 1000$! Pat yourself on the back.
event_text:
There's a massive sale at the Malwart. Half off! Send as many cultists as you can for massive savings.
Option 1: Send 10 cultists
Option 2: Send 20 cultists
Option 3: We don't need no sales. What are we, poor?

conclusion_1: The rival cult has been destroyed and your cultists are quite satisfied. Unfortunately though, a few of them died in the attack.
conclusion_2: The rival cult has unexpectedly attacked! We've chased them off, but we've lost ten cultists. Needless to say, they're quite made you didn't let them attack first.
conclusion_3: Wise thinking. We were attacked right away, but we were ready to take them on and suffered no losses!
event_text:
A rival cult has placed its headquarters right across the street. How bold. Needles to say, our cultists are itching to give them a good beating. They might get annoyed if you don't let them attack.
Option 1: Let them have it!
Option 2: Let them be, we shouldn't take needless risks.
Option 3: Let them make the first move. They're bound to mess it up.

conclusion_1: Although you tried your best, the policemen ran away screaming the moment you tried to explain them. How rude.
conclusion_2: Imprison them we have. They even had some money on them, which we've taken.
conclusion_3: The police enjoyed the sacrifice so much, they gave us a lot of magic in return. A true lesson in gratefulness.
event_text:
The federal police just knocked at our door. It seems they've heard rumours of human sacrifice. We keep telling them they're wrong, but they're quite persistent. It appears they might need a little ''convincing''.
Option 1: Bring them here. I'm sure they'll understand if I explain myself.
Option 2: Imprison them, they'll make good hostages.
Option 3: They're not wrong, actually. We do practice human sacrifice. I'm glad it's got them interested. I'll let them experience it first-hand, as a reward.

conclusion_1: Although you tried your best, it seems they ran away screaming the moment you tried to explain them. How rude, it's almost like they were scared of your magnificience. At least they probably won't bother us anymore.
conclusion_2: Imprison them we have. They even had some money on them, which we've taken.
conclusion_3: The police enjoyed the sacrifice so much, they gave us a lot of magic in return. A true lesson in gratefulness.
event_text:
The federal police just knocked at our door. It seems they've heard rumours of human sacrifice. We keep telling them they're wrong, but they're quite persistent. It appears they might need a little ''convincing''.
Option 1: Bring them here. I'm sure they'll understand if I explain myself.
Option 2: Imprison them, they'll make good hostages.
Option 3: They're not wrong, actually. We do practice human sacrifice. I'm glad it's got them interested. I'll let them experience it first-hand, as a reward.

conclusion_1: Seems like a good deal. Time to starve some cultists!
conclusion_2: True, 5000$ is a scam. Good thing you kept your money.
conclusion_3: The sacrifice was succesful. We gained a decent 1000 magic
event_text:
Some guy just knocked on the door selling ''life insurance''. Do you want it? He says he'll give us 1000$ every time one of our cultists dies from hunger. It'll cost us 5000$ first, though.
Option 1: Sounds good to me.
Option 2: No way.
Option 3: Salesmen deserve death. Sacrifice him!

conclusion_1: Seems like that did the trick. Your magic even went up!
conclusion_2: Are you sure? Alright, then... Seems like your magic's been going down, though...
conclusion_3: True, nothing like a good sacrifice to brighten your day. We've even generated 5000 magic. Sure, the cultists hate it, but it's worth it.
event_text:
You've seemed a bit depressed as of late. Let me offer you some counselling, it might cheer you up.
Option 1: Yeah, I guess you're right.
Option 2: No... I'm fine...
Option 3: I'm not depressed, I just need a little magic. Sacrifice five cultists for me, please.

conclusion_1: That ghost had a bunch of magic stored up, you just gained 3000. Plus, your cultists trust you even more now!
conclusion_2: While your cultists hated it at first, it seems the ghost ended up growing on them. You've gained a lot of trust.
conclusion_3: Well, seems the cultists were able to get rid of the ghost. They hate you for it, though.
event_text:
We've had a ghost show up and it's scaring the shit out of our cultists. They're asking for something to be done about it.
Option 1: Eat the ghost.
Option 2: Nah, I like ghosts. Let's keep him as a pet.
 Option 3: Eeeek, a ghost? Get the cultists to kill it and fast.
